io.reinert.requestor.core

Interface Store

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Saver
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DeserializableResponse, DeserializableResponseInProcess, IncomingResponse, InProcess, MutableResponse, MutableSerializedRequest, MutableSerializedResponse, PollingRequest<T>, PreparedRequest, ProcessableRequest, ProcessableResponse, Request<T>, RequestInProcess, Response, ResponseHeader, ResponseInProcess, SerializableRequestInProcess, SerializedRequest, SerializedRequestInProcess, SerializedResponse, SerializedResponseInProcess, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseService, DeferredPollingRequest, IncomingResponseImpl, RawResponse, RestService, Session

    public interface Store
extends Saver
    A place to save/retrieve any object by key.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the data associated with this Store firing the removed event for each key saved in it.
      void clear(boolean fireRemovedEvent)
      Clears the data associated with this Store optionally firing the removed event for each key saved in it.

      Checks if there's an object associated with the given key.
      boolean exists(String key, Object value)
      Checks if there's an object associated with the given key and if it's equals to the given value.

      Retrieves the data object saved with the given key.

      Retrieves the value of the data saved with the given key.

      Registers a handler to be executed after this key's data expires (ttl times out).
      Store onRemoved(String key, Store.Handler handler)
      Registers a handler to be executed after this key's data is removed from the store.
      Store onSaved(String key, Store.Handler handler)
      Registers a handler to be executed after a new data is saved into the store.

      Refreshes the data saved with this key extending its valid time for its original TTL.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieve

        @Deprecated
<T> T retrieve(String key)
        Deprecated. Use getValue(String) instead.
        NOTE: Renamed to getValue. It will be removed in version 1.3.

      • getValue

        <T> T getValue(String key)
        Retrieves the value of the data saved with the given key.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to typecast the object returned
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the data
        Returns:
        The value saved with the key. Null otherwise.

      • getData

        Store.Data getData(String key)
        Retrieves the data object saved with the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the data
        Returns:
        The Data object saved with the key. Null otherwise.

      • save

        Store save(String key,
           Object value)
        Saves the value into the store associated with the key. Being a request scope store, the data will be available during the request/response lifecycle only.
        Specified by:
        save in interface Saver
        Parameters:
        key - A key to associate the data
        value - The data to be persisted

      • save

        Store save(String key,
           Object value,
           Store.Level level)
        Saves the value into the store associated with the key. Being a request scope store, the data will be available during the request/response lifecycle only. If you want to persist it in the immediate parent store, set the level param to Level.PARENT. If you want to persist it in the root store, set the level param to Level.ROOT.
        Parameters:
        key - A key to associate the data
        value - The data to be persisted
        level - Whether the data should be persisted in the underlying stores or not

      • save

        Store save(String key,
           Object value,
           long ttlMillis,
           Store.Level level)
        Saves the value into the store associated with the key. Being a request scope store, the data will be available during the request/response lifecycle only. If you want to persist it in the immediate parent store, set the level param to Level.PARENT. If you want to persist it in the root store, set the level param to Level.ROOT.
        Parameters:
        key - A key to associate the data
        value - The data to be persisted
        ttlMillis - Time to live, i.e., the period when the data will still be valid, in milliseconds
        level - Whether the data should be persisted in the underlying stores or not

      • save

        Store save(String key,
           Object value,
           long ttlMillis)
        Saves the value into the store associated with the key during the TTL period.
        Parameters:
        key - A key to associate the data
        value - The data to be persisted
        ttlMillis - Time to live, i.e., the period when the data will still be valid, in milliseconds

      • exists

        boolean exists(String key)
        Checks if there's an object associated with the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the object
        Returns:
        True if there's any data associated with the key. False otherwise.

      • exists

        boolean exists(String key,
               Object value)
        Checks if there's an object associated with the given key and if it's equals to the given value.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the object
        value - The value to compare equality
        Returns:
        True if there's an object equals to the given value associated with the key. False otherwise.

      • remove

        Store.Data remove(String key)
        Removes the data associated with this key. Being a request scope store, only the data that was added in the request/response lifecycle is erased. Being a session scope store, any data in the store is erased.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the data
        Returns:
        The data that was removed or null if there was no data associated with the given key.

      • refresh

        Store.Data refresh(String key,
                   long ttlMillis)
        Refreshes the data saved with this key extending its valid time for the given TTL. It affects only the local store, i.e., it's not residually executed in the upstream stores.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the data
        ttlMillis - Time to live, i.e., the period when the data will still be valid, in milliseconds
        Returns:
        The data that was refreshed or null if there was no data associated with the given key.

      • refresh

        Store.Data refresh(String key)
        Refreshes the data saved with this key extending its valid time for its original TTL. It affects only the local store, i.e., it's not residually executed in the upstream stores.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the data
        Returns:
        The data that was refreshed or null if there was no data associated with the given key.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the data associated with this Store firing the removed event for each key saved in it. Being a request scope store, only the data that was added in the request/response lifecycle is erased. Being a session scope store, any data in the store is erased.

      • clear

        void clear(boolean fireRemovedEvent)
        Clears the data associated with this Store optionally firing the removed event for each key saved in it. Being a request scope store, only the data that was added in the request/response lifecycle is erased. Being a session scope store, any data in the store is erased.
        Parameters:
        fireRemovedEvent - Flag to determine whether the onRemoved handlers should be triggered for each key

      • onSaved

        Store onSaved(String key,
              Store.Handler handler)
        Registers a handler to be executed after a new data is saved into the store.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler to be executed
        Returns:
        This store

      • onRemoved

        Store onRemoved(String key,
                Store.Handler handler)
        Registers a handler to be executed after this key's data is removed from the store.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler to be executed
        Returns:
        This store

      • onExpired

        Store onExpired(String key,
                Store.Handler handler)
        Registers a handler to be executed after this key's data expires (ttl times out).
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler to be executed
        Returns:
        This store
